â
'''Kubuntu''' is an official derivative of the [[Ubuntu (Linux distribution)|Ubuntu]] [[Linux distribution]] using the [[KDE]] graphical environment instead of [[GNOME]]. It is part of the Ubuntu project and uses the same underlying system. Kubuntu and Ubuntu can work alongside each other by installing the ubuntu-desktop and kubuntu-desktop packages. Every package in Kubuntu shares the same repositories as Ubuntu.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.kubuntu.org/faq.php |title=Kubuntu FAQ}}</ref> Kubuntu CDs can be ordered through the [https://shipit.kubuntu.org Shipit] service. It is released regularly and predictably.<ref>[https://wiki.kubuntu.org/Kubuntu Kubuntu Wiki]</ref>
+
'''Kubuntu''' is an official derivative of the [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu]] [[Linux distribution]] using the [[KDE]] graphical environment instead of [[GNOME]]. It is part of the Ubuntu project and uses the same underlying system. Kubuntu and Ubuntu can work alongside each other by installing the ubuntu-desktop and kubuntu-desktop packages. Every package in Kubuntu shares the same repositories as Ubuntu.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.kubuntu.org/faq.php |title=Kubuntu FAQ}}</ref> Kubuntu CDs can be ordered through the [https://shipit.kubuntu.org Shipit] service. It is released regularly and predictably.<ref>[https://wiki.kubuntu.org/Kubuntu Kubuntu Wiki]</ref>
